intro: Geissomeria dichroa, commonly known as the two-colored goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along streambanks, preferring partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Geissomeria dichroa plays an important role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
